item.title: Content based caching with Make
item.description: On several occasions when building complex projects, I have been tempted to set up Bazel to help speed up the build process; after all, it has a lot to offer: only building what has changed, caching built artifacts, and sharing that cache between machines for even more speed. TLDR We can use Make and a couple of short shell scripts to implement file content-based caching and read/write that cache to remote storage, such as S3.
